dmca.title: [Fwd: [ABUSE] copyright violations - passportvisa.org]
dmca.body:
To Whom It May Concern:

Please note that below-referenced copyright infringement notice does not
substantially comply with the required notification elements of the Digital
Millennium Copyright Act of 1998 ("DMCA").

Please note that we have not passed on the substantive merits of your claim.

Please visit our web site at www.theplanet.com/legal.
 
Legal Response Team
THEPLANET.COM INTERNET SERVICES, INC.
-----Original Message-----
From: abuseadm@theplanet.com [mailto:abuseadm@theplanet.com] On Behalf Of
The Planet Policy Enforcement
Sent: Thursday, February 09, 2006 11:57 AM
To: copyright@theplanet.com; shane_best@yahoo.com
Subject: [Fwd: [ABUSE] copyright violations - passportvisa.org]

-----BEGIN PGP SIGNED MESSAGE-----
Hash: SHA1

Your email is being forwarded on to our Copyright counsel for review, at the
address of copyright@theplanet.com.

- -------- Original Message --------
Subject: [ABUSE] copyright violations - passportvisa.org
Date: Thu, 9 Feb 2006 06:57:53 -0800 (PST)
From: Shane Best <shane_best@yahoo.com>
To: abuse@theplanet.com

Hello,

I see violations of copyright abuse on the website passportvisa.org.

If you look closely at the links I have provided you will notice that not
only is the english wording on the links (within the pages) identical but so
is the capitalisation of letters.


some examples.
http://passportvisa.org/Passport/India-Passport/India-Passport.html
http://projectvisa.com/countryinfo.asp?countrycode=in
(Two links at the bottom of the page are identical)

http://passportvisa.org/Passport/Indonesia-Passport/Indonesia-Passport.html
http://projectvisa.com/countryinfo.asp?countrycode=id
(Last link at bottom of the page is identical)

http://passportvisa.org/Passport/Kyrgyzstan-Passport/Kyrgyzstan-Passport.htm
l
http://projectvisa.com/countryinfo.asp?countrycode=kg
(Link Kyrgyzstan embassies)

http://passportvisa.org/Passport/Macau-Passport/Macau-Passport.html
http://projectvisa.com/countryinfo.asp?countrycode=mo
(Link to macau tourism, identical)

http://passportvisa.org/Passport/Malaysia-Passport/Malaysia-Passport.html
http://projectvisa.com/countryinfo.asp?countrycode=my
(two identical links)

http://passportvisa.org/Passport/Mongolia-Passport/Mongolia-Passport.html
http://projectvisa.com/countryinfo.asp?countrycode=mn
(one identical link)

http://passportvisa.org/Passport/Myanmar-Passport/Myanmar-Passport.html
http://projectvisa.com/countryinfo.asp?countrycode=mm
(one identical link)

http://passportvisa.org/Passport/North-Korea-Passport/North-Korea-Passport.h
tml
http://projectvisa.com/countryinfo.asp?countrycode=kp
(one identical link)

http://passportvisa.org/Passport/Thailand-Passport/Thailand-Passport.html
http://projectvisa.com/countryinfo.asp?countrycode=th
(one identical link, complete with my strange english)

http://passportvisa.org/Passport/Uzbekistan-Passport/Uzbekistan-Passport.htm
l
http://projectvisa.com/countryinfo.asp?countrycode=uz
(one identical link)

http://passportvisa.org/Passport/Vietnam-Passport/Vietnam-Passport.html
http://projectvisa.com/countryinfo.asp?countrycode=vn
(identical link)

and on and on....
There are many more examples where links have been directly copied.

This website appears to be hosted on your service, please can you take it
down as soon as possible.

Regards,
Shane Best



- --
Thanks,

Policy Enforcement
The Planet Internet Services, Inc.
http://www.theplanet.com/legal/aup.html
-----BEGIN PGP SIGNATURE-----
Version: GnuPG v1.4.2 (MingW32)
Comment: Using GnuPG with Mozilla - http://enigmail.mozdev.org

=8mx/
